Browse the source code of netbsd/external/ibm-public/postfix/dist/src/global/deliver_pass.c

1/* $NetBSD: deliver_pass.c,v 1.2 2017/02/14 01:16:45 christos Exp $ */
2
3/*++
4/* NAME
5/* deliver_pass 3
6/* SUMMARY
7/* deliver request pass_through
8/* SYNOPSIS
9/* #include <deliver_request.h>
10/*
11/* int deliver_pass(class, service, request, recipient)
12/* const char *class;
13/* const char *service;
14/* DELIVER_REQUEST *request;
15/* RECIPIENT *recipient;
16/*
17/* int deliver_pass_all(class, service, request)
18/* const char *class;
19/* const char *service;
20/* DELIVER_REQUEST *request;
21/* DESCRIPTION
22/* This module implements the client side of the `queue manager
23/* to delivery agent' protocol, passing one recipient on from
24/* one delivery agent to another.
25/*
26/* deliver_pass() delegates delivery of the named recipient.
27/*
28/* deliver_pass_all() delegates an entire delivery request.
29/*
30/* Arguments:
31/* .IP class
32/* Destination delivery agent service class
33/* .IP service
34/* String of the form \fItransport\fR:\fInexthop\fR. Either transport
35/* or nexthop are optional. For details see the transport map manual page.
36/* .IP request
37/* Delivery request with queue file information.
38/* .IP recipient
39/* Recipient information. See recipient_list(3).
40/* DIAGNOSTICS
41/* LICENSE
42/* .ad
43/* .fi
44/* The Secure Mailer license must be distributed with this software.
45/* BUGS
46/* One recipient at a time; this is OK for mailbox deliveries.
47/*
48/* Hop status information cannot be passed back.
49/* AUTHOR(S)
50/* Wietse Venema
51/* IBM T.J. Watson Research
52/* P.O. Box 704
53/* Yorktown Heights, NY 10598, USA
54/*--*/
55
56/* System library. */
57
58#include <sys_defs.h>
59
60/* Utility library. */
61
62#include <msg.h>
63#include <vstring.h>
64#include <vstream.h>
65#include <split_at.h>
66#include <mymalloc.h>
67
68/* Global library. */
69
70#include <mail_params.h>
71#include <deliver_pass.h>
72#include <dsb_scan.h>
73#include <defer.h>
74#include <rcpt_print.h>
75
76#define DELIVER_PASS_DEFER 1
77#define DELIVER_PASS_UNKNOWN 2
78
79/* deliver_pass_initial_reply - retrieve initial delivery process response */
80
81static int deliver_pass_initial_reply(VSTREAM *stream)
82{
83 int stat;
84
85 if (attr_scan(stream, ATTR_FLAG_STRICT,
86 RECV_ATTR_INT(MAIL_ATTR_STATUS, &stat),
87 ATTR_TYPE_END) != 1) {
88 msg_warn("%s: malformed response", VSTREAM_PATH(stream));
89 stat = -1;
90 }
91 return (stat);
92}
93
94/* deliver_pass_send_request - send delivery request to delivery process */
95
96static int deliver_pass_send_request(VSTREAM *stream, DELIVER_REQUEST *request,
97 const char *nexthop,
98 RECIPIENT *rcpt)
99{
100 int stat;
101
102 attr_print(stream, ATTR_FLAG_NONE,
103 SEND_ATTR_INT(MAIL_ATTR_FLAGS, request->flags),
104 SEND_ATTR_STR(MAIL_ATTR_QUEUE, request->queue_name),
105 SEND_ATTR_STR(MAIL_ATTR_QUEUEID, request->queue_id),
106 SEND_ATTR_LONG(MAIL_ATTR_OFFSET, request->data_offset),
107 SEND_ATTR_LONG(MAIL_ATTR_SIZE, request->data_size),
108 SEND_ATTR_STR(MAIL_ATTR_NEXTHOP, nexthop),
109 SEND_ATTR_STR(MAIL_ATTR_ENCODING, request->encoding),
110 SEND_ATTR_INT(MAIL_ATTR_SMTPUTF8, request->smtputf8),
111 SEND_ATTR_STR(MAIL_ATTR_SENDER, request->sender),
112 SEND_ATTR_STR(MAIL_ATTR_DSN_ENVID, request->dsn_envid),
113 SEND_ATTR_INT(MAIL_ATTR_DSN_RET, request->dsn_ret),
114 SEND_ATTR_FUNC(msg_stats_print, (void *) &request->msg_stats),
115 /* XXX Should be encapsulated with ATTR_TYPE_FUNC. */
116 SEND_ATTR_STR(MAIL_ATTR_LOG_CLIENT_NAME, request->client_name),
117 SEND_ATTR_STR(MAIL_ATTR_LOG_CLIENT_ADDR, request->client_addr),
118 SEND_ATTR_STR(MAIL_ATTR_LOG_CLIENT_PORT, request->client_port),
119 SEND_ATTR_STR(MAIL_ATTR_LOG_PROTO_NAME, request->client_proto),
120 SEND_ATTR_STR(MAIL_ATTR_LOG_HELO_NAME, request->client_helo),
121 /* XXX Should be encapsulated with ATTR_TYPE_FUNC. */
122 SEND_ATTR_STR(MAIL_ATTR_SASL_METHOD, request->sasl_method),
123 SEND_ATTR_STR(MAIL_ATTR_SASL_USERNAME, request->sasl_username),
124 SEND_ATTR_STR(MAIL_ATTR_SASL_SENDER, request->sasl_sender),
125 /* XXX Ditto if we want to pass TLS certificate info. */
126 SEND_ATTR_STR(MAIL_ATTR_LOG_IDENT, request->log_ident),
127 SEND_ATTR_STR(MAIL_ATTR_RWR_CONTEXT, request->rewrite_context),
128 SEND_ATTR_INT(MAIL_ATTR_RCPT_COUNT, 1),
129 ATTR_TYPE_END);
130 attr_print(stream, ATTR_FLAG_NONE,
131 SEND_ATTR_FUNC(rcpt_print, (void *) rcpt),
132 ATTR_TYPE_END);
133
134 if (vstream_fflush(stream)) {
135 msg_warn("%s: bad write: %m", VSTREAM_PATH(stream));
136 stat = -1;
137 } else {
138 stat = 0;
139 }
140 return (stat);
141}
142
143/* deliver_pass_final_reply - retrieve final delivery status response */
144
145static int deliver_pass_final_reply(VSTREAM *stream, DSN_BUF *dsb)
146{
147 int stat;
148
149 if (attr_scan(stream, ATTR_FLAG_STRICT,
150 RECV_ATTR_FUNC(dsb_scan, (void *) dsb),
151 RECV_ATTR_INT(MAIL_ATTR_STATUS, &stat),
152 ATTR_TYPE_END) != 2) {
153 msg_warn("%s: malformed response", VSTREAM_PATH(stream));
154 return (DELIVER_PASS_UNKNOWN);
155 } else {
156 return (stat ? DELIVER_PASS_DEFER : 0);
157 }
158}
159
160/* deliver_pass - deliver one per-site queue entry */
161
162int deliver_pass(const char *class, const char *service,
163 DELIVER_REQUEST *request,
164 RECIPIENT *rcpt)
165{
166 VSTREAM *stream;
167 DSN_BUF *dsb;
168 DSN dsn;
169 int status;
170 char *saved_service;
171 char *transport;
172 char *nexthop;
173
174 /*
175 * Parse service into transport:nexthop form, and allow for omission of
176 * optional fields
177 */
178 transport = saved_service = mystrdup(service);
179 if ((nexthop = split_at(saved_service, ':')) == 0 || *nexthop == 0)
180 nexthop = request->nexthop;
181 if (*transport == 0)
182 msg_fatal("missing transport name in \"%s\"", service);
183
184 /*
185 * Initialize.
186 */
187 stream = mail_connect_wait(class, transport);
188 dsb = dsb_create();
189
190 /*
191 * Get the delivery process initial response. Send the queue file info
192 * and recipient info to the delivery process. Retrieve the delivery
193 * agent status report. The numerical status code indicates if delivery
194 * should be tried again. The reason text is sent only when a destination
195 * should be avoided for a while, so that the queue manager can log why
196 * it does not even try to schedule delivery to the affected recipients.
197 * XXX Can't pass back hop status info because the problem is with a
198 * different transport.
199 */
200 if (deliver_pass_initial_reply(stream) != 0
201 || deliver_pass_send_request(stream, request, nexthop, rcpt) != 0) {
202 (void) DSN_SIMPLE(&dsn, "4.3.0", "mail transport unavailable");
203 status = defer_append(DEL_REQ_TRACE_FLAGS(request->flags),
204 request->queue_id, &request->msg_stats,
205 rcpt, "none", &dsn);
206 } else if ((status = deliver_pass_final_reply(stream, dsb))
207 == DELIVER_PASS_UNKNOWN) {
208 (void) DSN_SIMPLE(&dsn, "4.3.0", "unknown mail transport error");
209 status = defer_append(DEL_REQ_TRACE_FLAGS(request->flags),
210 request->queue_id, &request->msg_stats,
211 rcpt, "none", &dsn);
212 }
213
214 /*
215 * Clean up.
216 */
217 vstream_fclose(stream);
218 dsb_free(dsb);
219 myfree(saved_service);
220
221 return (status);
222}
223
224/* deliver_pass_all - pass entire delivery request */
225
226int deliver_pass_all(const char *class, const char *service,
227 DELIVER_REQUEST *request)
228{
229 RECIPIENT_LIST *list;
230 RECIPIENT *rcpt;
231 int status = 0;
232
233 /*
234 * XXX We should find out if the target transport can handle
235 * multi-recipient requests. Unfortunately such code is hard to test,
236 * rarely used, and therefore will be buggy.
237 */
238 list = &request->rcpt_list;
239 for (rcpt = list->info; rcpt < list->info + list->len; rcpt++)
240 status |= deliver_pass(class, service, request, rcpt);
241 return (status);
242}
